doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 17 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 4/20/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 17 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 4/20/1987]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Joyce Hunter, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund2. Announcement of GCN Pledge Month3. Discussion of openly-gay Harry Britt's loss to Nancy Pelosi for the position of Californian Democratic member of Congress, discussion of gay politicians and the gay voting blockCOMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund4. Vice-President George Bush finally takes a stance on AIDS prevention and education, but only in the private sphere, also the outspokenness of Surgeon General Everett Koop5. AIDS organizations in Puerto RicoCOMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser6. Anti-gay prejudice and heterosexual bias7. News Watch, Georgetown University persuades a Maryland state representative a bill to give them funding for an expansion, after the university refused to comply with Washington DC's human rights law8. Idaho requires those applying for a marriage license to be tested for HIV9. Moscow, USSR opens an anonymous AIDS testing site for foreigners and those who have had sex with foreigners10. Britain's Princess Diana opens the country's first AIDS ward, in order to dispel myth of infection by close contactCOMMERCIAL: 10th Annual Awards Evening for the Fund for Human Dignity11. Sports Report, on location with The Times Squares, a gay-oriented square dance group12. Lavender Health, interview with Karen Solomon, a coordinator of the AIDS Counseling and Testing Site of the NYC Department of Health, discussion of HIV test13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of Broadway production of Harvey Fierstein's three one-acts, "Safe Sex"2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with [Frederick] Davies, star of the one-man show, "The Great Truman Capote"3. Episode of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "Catching Up is Hard to Do"4. Closing credits
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 17 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 4/20/1987]: April 1987
